result.execSummary:
Ronald L Williamson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Ronald L Williamson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: signed and completed by the defendant on 4/12/2022.

03:59 PM Defendant Ronald L Williamson in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant completes the waiver of attorney form.  Court reviews waiver of attorney form with the defenant.  Defendant waives extradition.  All parties sign waiver of extradition form.  Court reviews waiver of extradition form with the defendant.  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on April 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Ronald L Williamson
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 04-11-2022)
Prior: 1059 Lakeview Drive, Hobart, IN 46342

01:54 PM Defendant Ronald L Williamson in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office, as the defendant refused.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and affidavit and waives reading of complaint and affidavit.  The defendant is ready to waive the extradition.  The Court will set this matter over for tomorrow to allow for the State to have the proper paperwork available to proceed with a waiver of extradition.  The defendant shall be held in the Waukesha County Jail until the next date.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Affidavit and State if Illinois warrant
